item.title: Late Start in Computer Programming
item.description: Recently I’ve been giving advice (sometimes unsolicited) to people who want to shift into computer programming as a career. Being a late bloomer in programming is definitely manageable, but I believe it requires careful planning and a specific behavior. Overview This has been beaten like a dead horse by #learn2code tweets and Youtube videos, but these are the two main goals to become a general application programmer: Learn the fundamentals of programming and the basics of how a computer works Learn one programming language and write programs in it Contribute to open source projects and/or have a personal project Behavior The most difficult undertaking and, what I think, is the most important factor for learning programming is the obsession needed to succeed.

item.title: The If-Else Programmer
item.description: I had a half-joke where I would tell people that all I did at a previous job was write if-else statements to fix every problem that came up. There are two reasons why I evolved into the if-else programmer: Ideas and creativity were ignored. Anything a developer offered to improve the code was rejected and deemed as not needed by management. The value was only found in things that instantly settled client demands.
